period.description: December 2025 AI news registry covering the most impactful developments in artificial intelligence, generative AI, large language models, and related technologies

events.title: OpenAI Releases GPT-5.2: Most Advanced Model for Professional Work
events.summary: OpenAI launched GPT-5.2 achieving 70.9% win rate against human experts on professional knowledge work. Model excels at spreadsheets, presentations, coding with 55.6% on SWE-Bench Pro. Available in Instant, Thinking, and Pro variants.

events.title: Gemini 3 Flash Released with Major Performance Boost
events.summary: Google released Gemini 3 Flash combining Pro-grade reasoning with Flash-level speed. 3x faster than previous generation at fraction of cost ($0.50/$3 per million tokens). Now default model in Gemini app globally.
key_points: Matches Gemini 3 Pro on many benchmarks
Default in Gemini app and Search

events.title: Gemini 3 Deep Think Achieves Top ARC-AGI-2 Score
events.summary: Google launched Gemini 3 Deep Think achieving 45.1% on ARC-AGI-2 with code execution, highest performance on abstract reasoning benchmark. Uses iterative parallel hypothesis exploration for complex problems.
key_points: Takes minutes but delivers better results

events.title: OpenAI Releases GPT-5.2-Codex for Agentic Coding
events.summary: OpenAI launched GPT-5.2-Codex achieving state-of-the-art on SWE-Bench Pro and Terminal-Bench 2.0. Features native context compaction, enhanced cybersecurity capabilities, and improved large-scale refactoring.
key_points: Default in Codex CLI and IDE

events.title: Z.AI Releases GLM-4.7: Open-Source Coding Model
events.summary: Z.AI launched GLM-4.7 (358B MoE, 32B active) achieving 73.8% on SWE-bench with Preserved Thinking. First open-source model to approach proprietary performance on coding benchmarks. MIT licensed, $3/month pricing.

events.title: Cursor Acquires Graphite for Code Review
events.summary: Cursor acquired Graphite for 'way over' $290M valuation. Combines AI code writing with AI code review, enabling stacked pull requests for faster development cycles. Both backed by Accel and a16z.

events.title: Meta Acquires Manus AI for $2+ Billion
events.summary: Meta acquired Chinese AI agent startup Manus for over $2B. Manus achieved 86.5% on GAIA benchmark, outperforming OpenAI's Deep Research. Features sandboxed virtual computers and multi-agent architecture.
key_points: Shift from models to execution capability

events.title: ChatGPT Adds Tone Personalization Controls
events.summary: OpenAI introduced adjustable warmth, enthusiasm, and emoji controls for ChatGPT. Users can dial up/down friendliness and energy levels. Addresses sycophancy complaints while enabling professional/casual tone switching.

events.title: OpenAI Admits Prompt Injection 'Here to Stay' for Atlas
events.summary: OpenAI confirmed prompt injection is persistent security challenge for ChatGPT Atlas browser agent. Deployed LLM-based automated attacker using RL to discover exploits before they're weaponized. Agent mode 'expands attack surface.'

events.title: New York Signs RAISE Act: AI Safety Legislation
events.summary: Governor Hochul signed RAISE Act making NY second state with major AI safety law after California. Requires safety protocols publication, 72-hour incident reporting, new DFS office. Fines up to $1M ($3M repeat).

events.title: Trump Executive Order Challenges State AI Regulation
events.summary: President Trump signed executive order threatening federal lawsuits and withholding funds to prevent 'onerous' state AI regulation. Calls for national policy framework. Creates taskforce to challenge state laws.

events.title: Authors File Major Copyright Lawsuit Against Six AI Companies
events.summary: John Carreyrou and other authors sued Anthropic, Google, OpenAI, Meta, xAI, and Perplexity for training on pirated books. Claims $1.5B Anthropic settlement inadequate. Argues training on stolen content is 'massive willful infringement.'

events.title: Adobe Faces Class Action Over AI Training Data
events.summary: Adobe sued for training SlimLM on SlimPajama-627B containing Books3 corpus. Plaintiff's guidebooks appeared in processed subset. Alleges training on copyrighted works without consent or compensation.

events.title: Nvidia Licenses Groq Technology in $20B Deal
events.summary: Nvidia struck non-exclusive licensing agreement with Groq reportedly worth $20B. Will hire Groq founder Jonathan Ross. Groq's LPU claims 10x faster inference at 1/10th energy. Nvidia's largest deal ever.

events.title: Nvidia Acquires SchedMD and Releases Nemotron 3
events.summary: Nvidia acquired SchedMD (Slurm developer) and released Nemotron 3 model family. Slurm remains open source. Nemotron 3 includes Nano, Super, Ultra variants for AI agents.

events.title: Linux Foundation Launches Agentic AI Foundation
events.summary: Linux Foundation launched AAIF with donations from Anthropic (MCP), Block (Goose), OpenAI (AGENTS.md). Members include AWS, Bloomberg, Cloudflare, Google. Aims to prevent proprietary fragmentation.

events.title: Anthropic Releases Agent Skills as Open Standard
events.summary: Anthropic released Agent Skills technology as open standard. Strategic bet that sharing approach will cement position in agent market. Makes Claude more capable for enterprise work.

events.title: Anthropic Releases Bloom: AI Behavioral Evaluation Tool
events.summary: Anthropic released Bloom open-source tool for automated behavioral evaluations of frontier LLMs. Generates configurable test suites to measure arbitrary traits without ground-truth labels.

events.title: Vercel Removes 80% of Agent Tools, Improves Accuracy
events.summary: Vercel cut 80% of d0 agent's tools, improving success rate from 80% to 100%. Fewer steps, fewer tokens, faster responses. Demonstrates less is more for agent design.
key_points: Raw CSV access vs complex tools

events.title: GitHub Copilot WRAP Methodology for Coding Agents
events.summary: GitHub introduced WRAP methodology (Write, Refine, Atomic, Pair) for effective Copilot agent use. Engineers using agent to clear backlogs with structured approach.

events.title: Google Releases Disco Browser with GenTabs
events.summary: Google Labs released Disco browser experiment featuring GenTabs that synthesize open tabs and chat history into interactive web applications. AI-generated apps from browser context.

events.title: NotebookLM Integrates with Gemini
events.summary: Google integrated NotebookLM with Gemini, allowing notebooks as sources. Combines notes and research for grounded responses. Deep Research reports now include visuals for Ultra users.

events.title: Google Releases Nano Banana for Precise Image Editing
events.summary: Google released Nano Banana enabling precise image editing by drawing, circling, or annotating directly on images. Tell Gemini where to make changes with finger or cursor.

events.title: Xiaomi Releases MiMo-V2-Flash: 309B Open Model
events.summary: Xiaomi released MiMo-V2-Flash (309B total, 15B active) achieving 150 tokens/sec inference. #1 on SEAL leaderboard. Open-source MoE model challenging Gemini 3 Flash.

events.title: Pentagon Partners with xAI to Deploy Grok
events.summary: Pentagon announced partnership with Elon Musk's xAI to deploy Grok across government systems. Integrates into GenAI.mil alongside Google's Gemini. Major expansion of military AI use.

events.title: Elon Musk: xAI Will Outpace Rivals with GPU Power
events.summary: Musk declared if xAI survives next 2-3 years, it will surpass OpenAI and Google by harnessing massive GPU computing power. Aggressive expansion plan for AI infrastructure with substantial financial backing.

events.title: Meta Abandons Open-Source for Proprietary Avocado Model
events.summary: Meta departing Llama open-source lineage for proprietary 'Avocado' model. Strategic pivot surprises industry, triggers internal unrest. Mounting competition from OpenAI and Google drives change.

events.title: China's Zhipu and MiniMax Race to IPO
events.summary: Zhipu AI and MiniMax filed for Hong Kong listings aiming to raise combined $1B. Racing to go public ahead of OpenAI and Anthropic. Offers glimpse into Chinese LLM sector burning cash under US chip restrictions.

events.title: Tencent Restructures AI, Promotes OpenAI Recruit
events.summary: Tencent promoted Vinces Yao Shunyu (ex-OpenAI) to chief AI scientist under CEO office. Major AI restructuring with new AI Infra and Data Computing Platform departments.
key_points: Yao from OpenAI to chief scientist

events.title: China Narrows AI Gap with US After DeepSeek
events.summary: Three years after ChatGPT shock, China narrowed AI gap with US. DeepSeek V3 and R1 on par with OpenAI's GPT and Meta's Llama. Turning point in Chinese AI capabilities despite chip restrictions.

events.title: DeepSeek Publishes Manifold-Constrained Framework
events.summary: DeepSeek published paper on 'manifold-constrained hyper-connections' framework for training AI systems at scale. CEO Liang Wenfeng among 19 co-authors. Suggests promising directions for evolution.

events.title: Stack Overflow Developer Survey: AI Trust Falling
events.summary: Stack Overflow survey shows 80% developers using AI tools but trust in accuracy fell from 40% to 29%. Positive favorability dropped 72% to 60%. 66% spending more time fixing 'almost-right' AI code.

events.title: Menlo Ventures: $37B Enterprise AI Spending in 2025
events.summary: Menlo Ventures reports enterprises spent $37B on generative AI in 2025, up 3.2x from $11.5B in 2024. $19B went to applications. 76% of use cases now purchased vs built. 10+ products over $1B ARR.

events.title: VCs Predict AI Coming for Labor in 2026
events.summary: VCs predict 2026 will see AI significantly impact labor markets. MIT study: 11.7% of jobs could be automated. Companies citing AI for layoffs even without shifting budgets to AI projects.

events.title: VCs: Enterprises Consolidating AI Vendor Spend
events.summary: VCs predict enterprises will increase AI budgets in 2026 but concentrate spending on fewer vendors. Experimentation period ending. Companies picking winners and rationalizing overlapping tools.

events.title: Sketchfab Mandates AI Disclosure for All Models
events.summary: Sketchfab (Epic Games) requires 'CreatedWithAI' label on all AI-generated models starting December 11. Previously only required for downloadable models. New search filters to find/exclude AI content.

events.title: Game Industry: AI Faced First Market Test
events.summary: Games with AI disclosures grossed $660M on Steam in 2025. First hard data on AI performance in games. Costs rising, revenue not matching. AI bubble concerns mounting in game development.

events.title: AI Supercharges Scientific Output While Quality Slips
events.summary: Cornell study published in Science shows AI supercharging scientific output but quality declining. More papers produced but citation impact and novelty decreasing. Quantity vs quality tradeoff.

events.title: Google Antigravity: AI-First IDE Launch
events.summary: Google released Antigravity AI-first IDE (Windsurf acquisition). Features Editor View and Manager View for orchestrating multiple agents. Supports Gemini 3, Claude Sonnet 4.5, OpenAI models. Free with generous rate limits.

events.title: AI Coding Tools Reach 92% Developer Adoption
events.summary: 92% of developers now using AI coding assistants regularly. Market projected to reach $12.3B by 2027. Landscape consolidated around IDE-native agents, terminal assistants, and enterprise platforms.

events.title: Anthropic Extends Claude Lead in Enterprise
events.summary: Menlo Ventures data shows Anthropic extending lead in enterprise LLM market share. Claude preferred for enterprise deployments. OpenAI and Google following.

events.title: AI December to Remember: Ambient Intelligence
events.summary: December 2025 marked AI becoming ambient - operating inside browsers, spreadsheets, calendars, email everywhere. 'AI, everywhere, all at once' strategy reduced context-switching friction.

events.title: Investors Focus on AI Agents and Vertical Solutions
events.summary: TechCrunch Disrupt VCs emphasize AI focus for 2026. Entrepreneurs must show passion, domain expertise, honest product-market fit. Unique data flywheels key differentiator. Resilience critical in fast-changing market.

events.title: Enterprise AI: Custom Models Over Silver Bullets
events.summary: VCs note enterprises realizing LLMs not silver bullet. Focus shifting to custom models, fine-tuning, evals, observability, orchestration, data sovereignty. Specialized over general-purpose.

events.title: AI Subset Converting to Consulting Businesses
events.summary: VCs predict subset of enterprise AI companies shifting from product to consulting. Starting with specific product, then replicating forward-deployed engineer model for additional customer use cases.

events.title: The Next Web: 2025 AI Recap
events.summary: The Next Web analysis: 2025 was year technology stopped being tomorrow's promise and became today's anchor. GPT-5 and Gemini 3 pushed boundaries but received measured reception. Questions about revenue beyond demos.

events.title: Stack Overflow Launches AI Assist
events.summary: Stack Overflow launched AI Assist prioritizing trusted, community-verified knowledge. Conversational interface for problem solving. Citation, attribution, human-validated answers non-negotiable. Model-agnostic approach.

events.title: AI Bubble or Revolution: Software Survival Question
events.summary: Stack Overflow analysis: Money pouring into AI industry raises bubble vs revolution question. Consolidation natural in early market. 45 of 153 HumanX companies (29%) likely to be acquired. Boom-bust cycle feature not bug.

events.title: AI Research Trends: Foundation Models and Agents
events.summary: December 2025 AI research shows GPT-5 improving lab protocols 79x, Gemini 3 pushing performance, DeepSeek V3.2 matching proprietary models. Agentic architectures and multimodal fusion gaining attention.
key_points: Data curation as important as size

events.title: UK and US Warn Prompt Injection May Never Be Solved
events.summary: UK National Cyber Security Centre warns prompt injection 'may never be totally mitigated.' OpenAI, Anthropic, Google focusing on layered defenses and continuous stress-testing rather than complete solution.

notes: This registry captures December 2025 AI developments with emphasis on model releases (GPT-5.2, Gemini 3 Flash, GLM-4.7), major acquisitions (Meta-Manus $2B+, Cursor-Graphite, Nvidia-Groq $20B), security challenges (prompt injection persistence), regulatory actions (NY RAISE Act, Trump EO), enterprise adoption patterns ($37B spending), and the shift toward agentic AI with standards efforts (AAIF). Notable themes include AI becoming ambient, trust declining despite adoption rising, consolidation in enterprise spending, and China narrowing the AI gap.
